content.description: Despite some ledges this climb stays interesting to the top.
content.location: Obvious dihedral that separates the steeper part of this wall and the lower angle section.

content.description: Tricky, slabby start lead to long moves past overhanging jugs.
content.protection: Similar to "Thing One" the first bolt of this climb is located at around 20 feet.  You can get pro in to the left near "Thing One", but going direct there is nothing there.  Bolts then lead to a chain anchor.
content.location: First bolted line to the right of "Thing One" near the end of the first cliff at Obscure Rock.

content.description: Fun overhanging jug climbing.  Once you pull out the steepest section on the route the holds get a little smaller and a few are deviously hiding right in front of your face.
content.protection: If you are using STL II you will see that this is a "Sport" route by the (B,C) at the end of the route description.  The first bolt is roughly 20 feet off the ground.  The second is at about the 35 foot mark.  I would hardly call that sport.  A .3 camalot works nicly in between or a small nut.  Good bolt protection from there to the chains.  It is also worth noting that it can be dicey getting to the first bolt as the Aspen fire swept right at the base of this cliff and the granite is exfoliating making some footholds temporary.
content.location: This is the first route past "Mask of the Red Death" on the same cliff.

content.description: A really nice line! All gear up a pretty clean corner! And should totally see more traffic! work the corner to pass a bulge then more corner to a roof... this roof is gnar forsure!!past that to some lower angel then another bugle/roof on the left and top outbring a double length and use the anchor of the route to the right to belay the second upthen walk off or rap that anchor back down  If you were to try and top rope this anchor probably too much friction  This should have its own anchor...
content.protection: a single rack with triples of .3-.5 wires alpines
content.location: predominant left facing corner system on left end of the wall

content.description:
2 climbs to the right of "Thing Two"... 

  A piece between the 4th and 5th bolt might be recommended, it's anywhere between 5.4 and 5.7 depending on who you ask, but without it, if you fell from near the 5th bolt, you'll ledge out 30 feet below..
A one sequence wonder (but a heck of a sequence) leading to an enduro section.  Easy but good at the end.  Slightly overhanging, crux holds are half to full pad.
content.location: Left side of the rock just right of the Obscured By Clouds dihedral and the Aurora Blues arete. Cleanest blankest section of rock with a well defined plate at mid-height.

content.description: Starts right of and shares chain anchors with Thing Two. The first bolt is a little high, but the climbing is not too difficult there. The route is challenging with a distinct crux down low.
Fun moves with an airy traverse.
content.location: Start in the Don't Die Hedral then work left on hand rail/foot rail, depending on how high you go before moving left, to the arete.  One more interesting section before it eases off to the anchors.

content.description: Climb pretty high and clip the first bolt while jamming in a pocket.  (A small cam is optional.)  After a few fun layback moves, the climb goes slightly right to an okay stance.  Move back left to good holds, fire the crux, and hang on for a few more steep moves with big holds.  Nice climbing here.
content.location: Just to the left of Chocolate Monsters, at the eastern end on Obscure.  Look for a tall layback flake.

content.description: After a tricky start (use a spotter if you want), clip a high first bolt.  Fairly strenuous climbing down low leads to big sloping ledge.  Move to the corner and pull the crux.  Great variety and a fun crux move make this a good climb.
content.location: Third bolted line from the right of obscure rock.
Left side of Obscure Rock is a bolted arete.  The route starts on the left side of the arete and wanders around to the right.  First route left of MASK.
